Question
========

In a survey with a random sample of 91 people, people were asked whether people agreed with the judge's ruling in the case of Wilders. In that case, the judge ruled that his film did not incite hatred or violence against Muslims. The percentage of people who agreed with the judge's ruling was 20%. The researchers wanted know if the percentage in the population was less than 25%. To that end the researchers set up a null hypothesis stating that the percentage of people who agree with the judge is 25%. The P-value under this test is

Answerlist
----------

* 0.1209
* 0.1353
* 0.8791

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.1209: Incorrect
* 0.1353: Correct
* 0.8791: Incorrect
